title: Who are the best late Victorian (ie, post-Dickens) novelists? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Post-Dickens” I take to mean British and Irish novelists who: 1) began or continued to write after 1870; and 2) lived most of their lives in the Victorian era. George Eliot Anthony Trollope Thomas Hardy Henry James* George Meredith Joseph Conrad* Robert Louis Stevenson Ada Leverson George Gissing Samuel Butler Wilkie Collins George Moore *Who became a British citizen

The problem I find with novelists of this era, like Dickens, is that they are too humanistic in their outlook. The exception who puts more spiritual input into her work is George Elliot. I have to mention Conan Doyle who in addition to Holmes also wrote stunningly descriptive historical novels, as well as Jules Verne who wrote not so much science fiction but adventure stories with scientific and technological input, together with HG Wells who did write science fantasy as well as personalised social novels.
